field.label: Domain
field.help: Enter one or multiple domains to route via SNI. The domain will be added to the "listener_wrapper". Essentially, all traffic that Caddy receives on its frontend listeners (most likely the default HTTP and HTTPS ports) is funnelled through this wrapper to be processed and routed.

field.label: Description
field.help: Enter a description for this Layer4 route.

field.label: Matchers
field.help: Match the traffic of the entered domains via one of the offered protocols. When the protocol matches, the traffic will be streamed to the chosen upstream domains (without terminating TLS). Since the Layer4 app matches the traffic before being received by the HTTP app, "HTTP Handlers" for the same domain name will not match anymore. Only protocols that send and evaluate SNI can be routed here. The matcher "tls sni" will route all entered domains to the upstreams. The matcher "not tls sni" will route all unmatched domains to the upstreams.

field.label: Upstream Domain
field.help: Enter a domain name or IP address of the upstream destination. If multiple are chosen, they will be load balanced with the default random policy.

field.label: Upstream Port
field.help: Choose a custom port for the upstream destination.

field.label: Upstream Fail Duration
field.help: Enables a passive health check when multiple destinations in "Upstream Domain" are set. "Fail Duration" is a value that defines how long to remember a failed request. A duration of 1 or more seconds enables passive health checking; the default is empty (off). A reasonable starting point might be 30s to balance error rates with responsiveness when bringing an unhealthy upstream back online.
